@Joel31113 You're also not even doing ranges right if this were slab, since the upper range is 10 not 9 (upper bound 11=10 , i.e. 1-10 and 11-20 and 21+, etc.) but this is also Range and Contracted, so yes use the Contracted Price = 100 * 15 * .85 (15% discount) = $1275

Step 1: "where contracted pricing is applicable" means Discount schedule applied is "Gold" (not "Silver" or "Bronze") - because object reference is set to Contracted Price for Gold.
Step 2: Next, within Gold Discount Schedule, the discount applied is 15% because Quantity is 15 i.e. in '11-20' tier. Hence each quantity net price is $ 85. 
Step 3: Then for 15 quantities with list price $100, net total price after discount is $85 *15 = $85 * 5 * 3 = $ 425 * 3 = $ 1275.
